@description.name: @description
@description.body: An abstract data cell renderer that does the basic coloring (borders, selected look, â€¦).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The default cell style. The value of this property will be provided to the cell renderer as cellInfo.style.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Handler for the theme change.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: the sum of the horizontal insets. This is needed to compute the box model independent size

@description.name: @description
@description.body: paddingLeft + paddingRight + borderRight

@description.name: @description
@description.body: the sum of the vertical insets. This is needed to compute the box model independent size

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the style sheet used for the table cells.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get a string of the cell element's HTML classes. This method may be overridden by sub classes.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The table cell HTML classes as string.
@return.description: The table cell HTML classes as string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the CSS styles that should be applied to the main div of this cell. This method may be overridden by sub classes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map} The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
@param.description:
The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} the CSS styles of the main div.
@return.description: the CSS styles of the main div.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Retrieve any extra attributes the cell renderer wants applied to this cell.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map} The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
@param.description:
The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{String}
   The extra attributes to be applied to this cell.
@return.description: The extra attributes to be applied to this cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the HTML that should be used inside the main div of this cell. This method may be overridden by sub classes.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map} The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.
@param.description:
The information about the cell.
          See {@link qx.ui.table.cellrenderer.Abstract#createDataCellHtml}.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} the inner HTML of the cell.
@return.description: the inner HTML of the cell.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Get the cell size taking the box model into account

@param.name: @param
@param.body: width {Integer} The cell's (border-box) width in pixel

@param.name: @param
@param.body: height {Integer} The cell's (border-box) height in pixel

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
insetX {Integer} The cell's horizontal insets, i.e. the sum of
    horizontal paddings and borders
@param.description:
The cell's horizontal insets, i.e. the sum of
    horizontal paddings and borders

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
insetY {Integer} The cell's vertical insets, i.e. the sum of
    vertical paddings and borders
@param.description:
The cell's vertical insets, i.e. the sum of
    vertical paddings and borders

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} The CSS style string for the cell size
@return.description: The CSS style string for the cell size

@description.name: @description
@description.body: interface implementation

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
cellInfo {Map} A map containing the information about the cell to
     create.
@param.description:
A map containing the information about the cell to
     create.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
htmlArr {String[]} Target string container. The HTML of the data
     cell should be appended to this array.
@param.description:
Target string container. The HTML of the data
     cell should be appended to this array.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean|undefined} A return value of true specifies that no additional cells in the row shall be rendered. This may be used, for example, for separator rows or for other special rendering purposes. Traditional cell renderers had no defined return value, so returned nothing (undefined). If this method returns either false or nothing, then rendering continues with the next cell in the row, which the normal mode of operation.
@return.description: A return value of true specifies that no additional cells in the row shall be rendered. This may be used, for example, for separator rows or for other special rendering purposes. Traditional cell renderers had no defined return value, so returned nothing (undefined). If this method returns either false or nothing, then rendering continues with the next cell in the row, which the normal mode of operation.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property defaultCellStyle. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultCellStyle}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property defaultCellStyle. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultCellStyle}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property defaultCellStyle. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #defaultCellStyle}.
